list.name: Default
list.comment:
Enabled gfServer and gfClient from script, moved aux objs to Auxilliary
Moved some of the auxilliary objects like ProgressBar, merge_ranges, etc to Auxilliary.py. Made some progress with count_dups. Further works requires renaming hits with annotations. Script can now start and stop gfServers automatically on a per-species basis. Note that the script has no sense of memory usage, so conceivably its trivial to crash your computer by running too many species.

task.summary: Default task

v0.1
Initial commit. Pretty sure RecBlast won't work, and so I'll have to rewrite the reciprocal part of RecBlast.
v0.2 - Began work on RecBlast2, based on the SearchIO package (looks cleaner) - Fixed the forward BLAST section of RecBlast to conform to PEP8 - Fixed file nomenclature to make I/O more legible
V0.4 - Checked all of RecBlast for PEP8 - Major rewrite of RecBlast. - Added blast()

V0.5 - Added and completed: - biosql_addrecord - biosql_recordids - biosql_getrecord - Added and "completed" fetchseq, just have to test and debug it - Blast is also done, just needs testing and debugging - Some changes in RecBlast, remains a WIP - Commented out RecBlast2, the concept of the rewrite using SearchIO will be revisited after I get RecBlast done - More formally declared sirblastalot, and added TODO - Added TODOs all-around - Added some FIXMEs to areas that were written, but which even before testing I know need more work - Misc. PEP8 changes.

V0.5.2 - Added and completed: - biosql_addrecord - biosql_recordids - biosql_getrecord - Added and "completed" fetchseq, just have to test and debug it - Blast is also done, just needs testing and debugging - Some changes in RecBlast, remains a WIP - Commented out RecBlast2, the concept of the rewrite using SearchIO will be revisited after I get RecBlast done - More formally declared sirblastalot, and added TODO - Added TODOs all-around - Added some FIXMEs to areas that were written, but which even before testing I know need more work - Misc. PEP8 changes.

V0.5.2 - Added and completed: - biosql_addrecord - biosql_recordids - biosql_getrecord - Added and "completed" fetchseq, just have to test and debug it - Blast is also done, just needs testing and debugging - Some changes in RecBlast, remains a WIP - Commented out RecBlast2, the concept of the rewrite using SearchIO will be revisited after I get RecBlast done - More formally declared sirblastalot, and added TODO - Added TODOs all-around - Added some FIXMEs to areas that were written, but which even before testing I know need more work - Misc. PEP8 changes. V0.6 - biosql_getseq is done - fetchseq is done - blast is done

V0.9 - recblast is almost 100% working, just needs some exception handling for empty searches - One last tweak needed, need to be able to calibrate the sequence range related to the BLAST hit to the actual content of the sequence fetched.

V1.0 - recblast is 100% working aside from maybe a little more overzealous error handling - recblast_MP is well on its way. Its a parallelized, Object-Oriented RecBlast. Its all you could ever want in a script. - V For Verbose Output implemented.
Enhancement-1 Develop Test Suite

Updated Fetchseq et al to match "scaffold" queries.
Since the Bowhead Whale genome does not use accession numbers in its labeling, but rather scaffolds, id_search was configured to search for scaffolds; the sequence lookup cascade was also changed to run searches with lookup key "Name" instead of "Scaffold" in these cases.

Added "add_length" option to FetchseqMP
add_length is a tuple of two numbers that correspond to a number of steps to add or subtract from the beginning and end of the query, respectively.

Added "add_length" option to FetchseqMP
add_length is a tuple of two numbers that correspond to a number of steps to add or subtract from the beginning and end of the query, respectively. Function adds the negative of add_length[0] to seq_length[k][0] to add to the left correctly.

Functionality check
Ran a test run using NCBIXML and made some changes to confirm that script would still run. Changes were in fact needed, and now it works again. Note that the SearchIO converter in Blast() was commented out for this test.

Integrated SearchIO.BlatIO into id_ranker()
Added a check to id_ranker for the type of record given to it. Added a function based on the UCSC percent identity algorithm as programmed by BioPython to get the percent identity of an entire hit as opposed to on a per-HSP basis. Added functions to filter BLAT hits based on number of HSPs, query length coverage, percent identity, and scores.

[V1.4] Initial BLAT compatibility release
Blat has been integrated from start to finish, and the whole program runs from start to finish as well. Because SearchIO is experimental, this release requires the use of the master branch of Biopython, version 1.70dev0, with a commit of 3d6e111 or newer due to previous issues with reading blatx output in either psl or pslx format. Additionally, the non-standard package multiprocess by uqfoundation (https://github.com/uqfoundation/multiprocess) was used to replace multiprocessing, since multiprocessing uses the pickle package which is incompatible with SearchIO due to Biopython issue #1241. When a release fixing the pickling issue comes out, I will retest the use of multiprocessing and weigh returning to it to keep non-standard package usage to a minimum.
Reorganized website files.

New print() function with built-in indent and markup params; PEP8 stuff
print() has been enhanced with options to indent the print statement to make the indent statements in the code neater to read. Also of note is the markup keyword, which will be placed between the indent and the text. This is for future formatting of output as Markdown files - on the to-do list is to edit this function to be a bit smarter about how it combines indents and markups so that things look solid in their final form. Also did some PEP8 maintenance from the last several edits.

Added new blat types 'oneshot blat' and 'oneshot tblat'
Newly added blat types will, instead of using a gfClient call to a gfServer, call blat to run a one-shot search instance. While inefficient time-wise, this option has some advantages in the form of not having to run many memory-costly gfServers for RecBlast runs involving few protein queries but many species.
Fixed Print, redirect_stdout added

Added '2bit' option to FetchSeq to get sequence from .2bit files
A '2bit' option was integrated into FetchSeq to allow fetching of sequence data directly from the same .2bit file used for Forward BLAT. This means that when running RecBLAT, you do not need a dedicated server for sequences, which in turn makes the program much more accessible. This does, however, require that twoBitToFa is installed on one's computer, and that it is located in your $PATH.

Enabled gfServer and gfClient from script, moved aux objs to Auxilliary
Moved some of the auxilliary objects like ProgressBar, merge_ranges, etc to Auxilliary.py. Made some progress with count_dups. Further works requires renaming hits with annotations. Script can now start and stop gfServers automatically on a per-species basis. Note that the script has no sense of memory usage, so conceivably its trivial to crash your computer by running too many species.

Initial commit. Pretty sure RecBlast won't work, and so I'll have to rewrite the reciprocal part of RecBlast.

[V1.4] Initial BLAT compatibility release
